Ставлю 10 из 10 что бы в неё играть надо врубать мозги а не смотреть прохождение других ютуберов и повторять за ними, как по мне тут я кипел очень сильно, в Халве тоже надо включать мозги и думать, а тут и ловушки проходить, и порталы ставить правильно надо что бы огородку перелететь, короче, застрял на пред последнее главе. Игру покупать тем кто хочет проверить и доказать свои "тупым одноклассникам" что ты умеешь думать и сможешь пройти эту игру, или же если вы прошли весь Half-Life до Half-Life 2 Episode Two то можете смело покупать эту игру, Рекомендую! (Пришлось ставить галочку что получил товар бесплатно так как вылазила ошибка)
Прикольная игра с низкими системными требованиями.

Preço: R$20,69. Paguei R$ 1,54 (Bundle com Portal 2 por R$ 3,08)
Portal™ é um novo jogo para um jogador da Valve. Estabelecido nos misteriosos Laboratórios Aperture Science, Portal é aclamado como um dos novos jogos mais inovadores no horizonte e oferecerá aos jogadores horas de jogabilidade única.
Data de lançamento: 10/out/2007
Tempo atual de jogo: 5h

Jogo de puzzle com ideia incrível e ótima execução. Um clássico instantâneo. The cake is a lie. Ps. Se você for como eu, que ama charadas intelectuais, mas possui pouca habilidade motora em games, até que Portal é tranquilo. Tirando uma fase ou outra, umas duas mecânicas, com um pouco mais de tempo é possível terminar as câmaras. Tirando talvez a última parte que (spoiler!) tem tempo. E eu não consigo passar justamente por isso.

Amorzinho 4.5/5, Replay 3/5 (desafios de tempo, número de portais e de número de passos)
Recomendo para todos os amantes de jogos de puzzle. Todos.

An amazing puzzle game with a mysterious ending! About to play the sequel

[i]Portal[/i] is a classic title by Valve that is just as enjoyable as the day it came out.

When talking about a universally praised game, it is hard to say anything really new about it. Personally, I have almost nothing but positive things to say about it, and understandably so. Having played through this game before years back, it wasn't as challenging and mind-blowing as it was the first time, but that boils down more to my prior knowledge of the groundbreaking physics and sly gravity tricks one can pull off here. At the time of writing this review, I have also not played [i]Portal 2[/i], so whatever more complex puzzles it may have don't effect my experience with this game. Although one could complain it is short, it was the first of its kind, and there are always the challenges and advanced chambers to visit if you think it went by too fast. Really, it's hard to criticize this game, as one would mostly just find themselves nitpicking and overanalyzing what is here.

The journey [i]Chell[/i] embarks on is at first simple, but it grows into a sinister and challenging affair that will test the player on their mastery of the game's mechanics and puzzle-solving skills. The eerie crawlspaces you find that used to contain a test subject similar to you that details their own experience can be haunting and paint a picture of the insanity being contained in these test chambers can inflict. The passive-aggressiveness of the only other seemingly sentient being you encounter, [i]GLaDOS[/i], can border on psychotic, and even further fuel your desire to escape your captor. This short but effective adventure is a classic experience, and it isn't hard to see why with how you are enveloped into an atmosphere attempting to crush you at every turn.

Whoever you are, [i]Portal[/i] is one of those games that anyone can enjoy and take something from. Even if one doesn't see this as particularly amazing, it help set a standard for puzzle games to come and remains to be a cultural icon of a video game. Countless references have been made to it and it will live on for a long time, just as the artificial intelligence that contains a bloodlust for its test subjects will. It is almost impossible to not recommend this game to you, as there are very few, if any, reasons to not try this masterpiece out.

[b][RATING: 9.1/10][/b]

Portal is one of those games that everyone who likes video games needs to play. He is absolutely perfect in everything he proposes to do. Its aesthetics, its sounds, its mechanics, its story and a flawless learning curve, everything in it is impeccable. It's hard to point out anything wrong with this game, one of those few that is 10/10.
Jogo mto foda deu 3 hrs de gameplay :)
It is just make fun! Even years after its release.

[b][h1]Un juego que [u]no[/u] superó la prueba del tiempo[/h1][/b]

[i]Hoy en pleno 2019 jugué por primera vez al portal y no puedo recomendarlo.[/i]

[b]Jugabilidad:[/b] la jugabilidad es tan simple como cómoda, quizás demasiado simple. El juego costa en moverse saltar y activar los portales.

[b]Trama:[/b] trama extremadamente simple con un plot twist. Lo único que se tienen que hacer es superar las pruebas.

[b]Niveles:[/b] todos los niveles de la historia son extremadamente simples. Los niveles avanzados que se desbloquean una vez pasado el modo historia son mucho más entretenidas que las de la historia, a pesar de que son las mismas con la dificultad aumentada. La mecánica del juego es el uso de portales para acceder a los diferentes niveles y el uso de la gravedad del juego a tu favor.

[i]El juego peca de ser corto. En 2 horas ya había pasado la historia, en 8 horas ya había superado todos los niveles avanzados y no me quedaban más ganas de jugar todos los desafíos.[/i]

[b]Yo conseguí en oferta el pack que viene con el portal 1 y 2 a 20$ (argentinos) y quizás hubiera pagado 40 pesos por cada uno de ellos, pero no más que eso.[/b]

Creo que no vale el precio inicial porque es demasiado corto, pero si te lo pillas en oferta, os juro que vale cada céntimo. Súper entretenido, te hace pensar, mecánicas y jugabilidad únicas. El boss es muy simple, pero su desarrollo como personaje es simplemente fantástico. La historia también te deja con ganas de más, pero para eso tenemos Portal 2, que está genial, y el modo coop es fantástico. Ambos juegos recomendados, una masa 8.5/10
This is one of the best games I've ever played. 10/10
